block.p: A light bulb will be introduced today that uses a high-frequency radio signal instead of a filament to produce light. The new bulb is more cost effective than existing bulbs and will last 14 years if lighted 4 hours a day, electrical engineers say. [ Page A1. ]

Wall Street has been intensively lobbying the members of Congress who are shaping new controls on the Government securities market in the wake of the Salomon Brothers bidding scandal. A bill that would impose new regulations is expected to gain the approval of the House Energy and Commerce Committee this week. Credit Markets. [ D1. ]

When BET Holdings went public last fall, the stock took off like a rocket. But since that October offering, the black-run cable television company and its new investors have found themselves riding more of a roller coaster than a rocket. [ D1. ]

Television stations affiliated with CBS said the network's plan to charge fees for some programs could cause them to drop some programming and, in extreme cases, to consider abandoning the network altogether. [ D9. ]

The "CBS Evening News" has been gaining steadily for most of this year, though network executives have not been bold enough to predict that it will stage a comeback comparable to that of CBS's prime-time shows. [ D8. ]

A blockade of a private port by Greenpeace seems to foreshadow bitter relations between environmentalists and business people at the Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro. [ D1. ]

As Europe's environmental debate moves from science to economics, the richest governments are turning to the marketplace as they grapple with the difficult question: what price the environment? The most ambitious attempt yet at an answer came when the European Community proposed a plan to fight pollution and global warming by imposing a tax on oil, coal, natural gas and other non-renewable forms of energy harmful to the environment.
